name: IOSink
comment:
Helper class to wrap a StreamConsumer<dart-core<dart-core>> and provide utility functions for writing to the StreamConsumer directly. The bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink buffers the input given by all bloodless/dart-core.StringSink methods and will delay an bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.addStream until the buffer is flushed.

When the bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink is bound to a stream (through bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.addStream) any call to the bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink will throw a bloodless/dart-core.StateError. When the bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.addStream completes, the bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink will again be open for all calls.

If data is added to the bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink after the sink is closed, the data will be ignored. Use the bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.done future to be notified when the bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink is closed.

encoding.name: encoding
encoding.comment: The bloodless/dart-convert.Encoding used when writing strings. Depending on the underlying consumer this property might be mutable.

done.name: done
done.comment: Get a future that will complete when the consumer closes, or when an error occurs. This future is identical to the future returned by bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.close.

add.name: add
add.comment:
Adds bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.add.data to the target consumer, ignoring bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.encoding.

The bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.encoding does not apply to this method, and the data list is passed directly to the target consumer as a stream event.

This function must not be called when a stream is currently being added using bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.addStream.

This operation is non-blocking. See bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.flush or bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.done for how to get any errors generated by this call.

The data list should not be modified after it has been passed to add.

write.name: write
write.comment:
Converts bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.write.obj to a String by invoking bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.toString and bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.adds the encoding of the result to the target consumer.

This operation is non-blocking. See bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.flush or bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.done for how to get any errors generated by this call.

writeAll.name: writeAll
writeAll.comment:
Iterates over the given bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.writeAll.objects and bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.writes them in sequence.

If bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.writeAll.separator is provided, a write with the separator is performed between any two elements of objects.

This operation is non-blocking. See bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.flush or bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.done for how to get any errors generated by this call.

writeln.name: writeln
writeln.comment:
Converts bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.writeln.obj to a String by invoking bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.toString and writes the result to this, followed by a newline.

This operation is non-blocking. See bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.flush or bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.done for how to get any errors generated by this call.

writeCharCode.name: writeCharCode
writeCharCode.comment:
Writes the bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.writeCharCode.charCode to this.

This method is equivalent to write(new String.fromCharCode(charCode)).

This operation is non-blocking. See bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.flush or bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.done for how to get any errors generated by this call.

addError.name: addError
addError.comment:
Passes the error to the target consumer as an error event.

This function must not be called when a stream is currently being added using bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.addStream.

This operation is non-blocking. See bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.flush or bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.done for how to get any errors generated by this call.

addStream.name: addStream
addStream.comment: Adds all elements of the given bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.addStream.stream to this.

flush.name: flush
flush.comment:
Returns a bloodless/dart-async.Future that completes once all buffered data is accepted by the to underlying bloodless/bloodless_mocks.StreamConsumer.

It's an error to call this method, while an bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.addStream is incomplete.

NOTE: This is not necessarily the same as the data being flushed by the operating system.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

done.name: done
done.comment:
The bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.done Future completes with the same values as bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.close, except for the following case:

  • The synchronous methods of bloodless/bloodless_mocks.EventSink were called, resulting in an error. If there is no active future (like from an addStream call), the bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.done future will complete with that error

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

write.name: write
write.comment: Converts bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.write.obj to a String by invoking bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.toString and adds the result to this.

writeAll.name: writeAll
writeAll.comment: Iterates over the given bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.writeAll.objects and bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.writes them in sequence.

writeln.name: writeln
writeln.comment: Converts bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.writeln.obj to a String by invoking bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.toString and adds the result to this, followed by a newline.

writeCharCode.name: writeCharCode
writeCharCode.comment:
Writes the bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.writeCharCode.charCode to this.

This method is equivalent to write(new String.fromCharCode(charCode)).

addStream.name: addStream
addStream.comment:
Consumes the elements of bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.addStream.stream.

Listens on bloodless/bloodless_mocks.IOSink.addStream.stream and does something for each event.

The consumer may stop listening after an error, or it may consume all the errors and only stop at a done event.
